results.title: What is this thing called food? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Thomas Tomizawa and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: Examines the use of chemicals in today’s food supply, with narration by Betty Furness. Shows how new food technology has served the consumer but points out a growing concern among scientists as to the possible effects of chemical additives on the human body.
results.description: Examines the use of chemicals in today’s food supply, with narration by Betty Furness. Shows how new food technology has served the consumer but points out a growing concern among scientists as to the possible effects of chemical additives on the human body.

results.title: What is space?
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Uses helicopters and imaginary trips through the universe to illustrate the vastness of space. Conducts experiments to show the presence of space in liquids and solids close to hand.

results.title: What is psychology?
results.creator_credit: David Stone and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Psychology attempts to explain human behaviour and mental processes. From early times man has been seeking ways of explaining behaviour, through philosophy, religion and science. This program introduces the five main strands of modern psychology: Behaviourism, Psychoanalysis and other clinical psychologies, Cognitive psychology, Socio-cultural psychology and Physiological psychology. It then goes on to show how the following programs will discuss different aspects of human behaviour such as sleep, memory, language, emotion and intellect in the light of these differing psychological approaches.

results.title: What is physical fitness?
results.creator_credit: Eric Horter and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: This film defines fitness and includes footage of high school student in action to demonstrates the five elements that constitute physical fitness: cardio-respiratory endurances, muscles endurance, flexibility and body composition. From the sereis “Fitness for living”.

results.title: What Is normal?
results.creator_credit: Steven Talley and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Part of the challenge of psychology is defining the line of what is normal and helping people who have stepped over that line. Probably the best way of defining abnormal behaviour is behaviour that prevents a person from being able to function. DSM III R is a manual which attempts to define mental disorders but not everyone can be slotted easily into categories. The program then looks at two case studies, one of severe depression and one of panic attacks and how these can be treated.

results.title: What is misuse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs and Medicine”.
Drug abuse means more than just addiction to harmful drugs. A neighbourhood pharmacist talks about the kinds of drugs and medicines being misused. His relations with his customers offer examples of varying degrees of misuse.
